meanings.definition: The condition of having an extra chromosome in a cell.
meanings.sent1: Trisomies can lead to genetic disorders.
meanings.sent2: Doctors diagnosed the baby with trisomies.
meanings.sent3: The trisomies in the cell were causing quite a genetic mix-up!
meanings.sent4: Her cells resembled a crowded party with trisomies as the extra guests.
meanings.sent5: The concept of trisomies is like having an unexpected extra puzzle piece in a completed picture.

meanings.definition: The presence of three copies of a particular chromosome in an individual.
meanings.sent1: Trisomies can result in genetic variations.
meanings.sent2: The genetic counselor explained the implications of trisomies.
meanings.sent3: The trisomies in his DNA seemed to be throwing a chromosome party!
meanings.sent4: Her genetic makeup was like a trisomies treasure trove waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The trisomies were like having an extra set of keys to unlock genetic mysteries.
